title.narrative: Rohingya Crisis Emergency WASH & Health Support project in Ukhiya, Cox’s Bazaar, Bangladesh

description.narrative: Currently, the health post is operating under ACT funded humanitarian response BGD-191 from January 2020 and will be continued till 30th November 2020. Prior to January 2020, this health post was supported by DEC Appeal. Due to funding shortage, it’s vital at this stage to secure resources and support from donors to continue the health post especially considering the gaps to tackle COVID-19 pandemic. CAID is proposing to continue the health post for the period of December 2020 to January 2021 through PWRDF support under the umbrella of ACT Appeal intervention “BGD-191”.

With the global COVID-19 pandemic sweeping Bangladesh, helpless host and Rohingya communities are at an extremely high risk of COVID-19, local response as prevention and treatment resources are scarce. Continuation of health services is required to build community awareness and knowledge of infectious disease preventative measures and practices relevant to the COVID-19 response and to strengthen existing health post to withstand the increased number of patients and strengthen referral. Increased community knowledge is key to preventing the spread of the disease and flattening the infection rate curve to minimize the strain on health services. Simultaneously, Health Posts require enhanced support to access personal protective equipment (PPE) and manage patients seeking care in a manner that minimizes the risk of cross-infection
